question: Which country houses the "Borjomi Strict Nature Reserve"?
explanation: Borjomi Strict Nature Reserve is an IUCN category Ia strict nature reserve and a protected area in Borjomi Municipality, Samtskhe-Javakheti region of Georgia. The tallest tree of the region â€” Caucasian fir grows in the protected area and can be more than 50 metres in height. It can be still higher in other locations with more moisture in western Caucasus and Abkhazia. Rare Caucasian Salamander habitat is protected at Borjomi Strict Nature Reserve.
